official-title.#text:
To require the Comptroller General of the United States to conduct studies on enrollment by racial
			 and ethnic minorities and by low-income seniors in the Medicare Advantage
			 program.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such
			 provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
GAO studies and reports on enrollment by racial and ethnic minorities and by low-income seniors in

shall conduct, with respect to each Medicare Advantage
			 population group (as defined in

text.#text:
the number of individuals in each State who are members of such Medicare Advantage population group
			 and who are enrolled for plan year 2014, and the number of such

			 determined through a survey of historical data regarding such enrollment),
			 in Medicare Advantage plans under the Medicare Advantage program under

the projected impact of payment reductions to such Medicare Advantage program, including such

and from
			 administrative actions, on the number of individuals who are members of
			 such Medicare Advantage population group in each State who are projected
			 to be enrolled for each plan year beginning with plan year 2015 in
			 Medicare Advantage plans under such Medicare Advantage program.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

header.#text: Definition of Medicare Advantage population group

term.#tail: means each of the following population groups:

text.#text: The group of individuals who are members of one or more racial or ethnic minority populations.
The group of individuals who are low-income seniors.
